titleStmt.title: A peaceable resolution of conscience touching our present impositions. Wherein loyalty & obedience are proposed, and settled upon their true foundation in Scripture, reason, and the constitution of this kingdom, against all resistance of the present powers: and for complyance with the laws, so far as may be in order to union. With a draught, or speciment of a bill for accomodation.
titleStmt.author: Humfrey, John, 1621-1719.

titleStmt.title: A peaceable resolution of conscience touching our present impositions. Wherein loyalty & obedience are proposed, and settled upon their true foundation in Scripture, reason, and the constitution of this kingdom, against all resistance of the present powers: and for complyance with the laws, so far as may be in order to union. With a draught, or speciment of a bill for accomodation.
titleStmt.author: Humfrey, John, 1621-1719.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Robert Clavel at the Peacock in St. Pauls Church Yard, Thomas Simmons at the Princes Arms, and Jacob Sampson next the Wonder Tavern in Ludgate-street,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

person.persName: Jacob Sampson next the Wonder Tavern
